intro: Gossampinus, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange to red berries containing three seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to urban environments.
